snippet: The Obama administration would prevent federal workers from attending seminars, receptions and social gatherings for free, which lobbyists have denounced as excessive.
abstract: Tough new limits proposed on the way special interests could court executive branch officials have prompted a fierce counterattack from lobbyists who fear they will no longer be able to host federal workers at conferences, cocktail parties and other events; rules, under consideration by the Obama administration, would extend restrictions now on political appointees to more than two million government workers.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration would prevent federal workers from attending seminars, receptions and social gatherings for free, which lobbyists have denounced as excessive.

headline.seo: Lobbyists Object to Proposed Limits on Courting Officials
headline.main: Limits on Lobbyists as Hosts? Simply Unworkable, They Say
headline.print_headline: Limits on Lobbyists as Hosts? Simply Unworkable, They Say
